FacilityName: TWIN COUNTY SERVICE COMPANY-MARION  NH3 PLANT

_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: NH3 BULK STORAGE TANK, PUMP, VALVES PLUMBING AND FITTINGS.  NH3 RISER ALL HOSES VALVES AND FITTINGS.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
                                                          MARION,IL  NH3- SITE


1.  FACILITY ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE AND EMERGENCY POLICY.

THE MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES OF TWIN COUNTY SERVICE COMPANY ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTIAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  IF AN ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEP,ARTMENT, OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE TO  PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.


THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED.

THE  PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY WHICH IS LOCATED AT 1501 EAST DEYOUNG STREET MARION, IL, IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS FOR SALE TO FARMERS.  ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION  AS A CROP NUTRIENT.THE STORAGE AND HANDLING SYSTEM CONSIST OF ONE STORAGE TANK (10,000 GALLONS), LOADING RISERS, ASSOCIATED PLUMBING AND NURSE TANKS.  ACCESS TO THE SITE IS RESTRICTED TO AUTHORIZED FACILITY  EMPLOYEES, AUTHORIZED MGT PERSONNEL AND AUTHORIZED CONTRACTORS. 

THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT CAN BE STORED WOULD BE 132,000 POUNDS. THIS INCLUDES ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT COULD BE STORED IN NURSE TANKS.


3.  THE WORSE-CASE RELEASE SCENARIO AND THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO.

THE WORSE CASE RELEASE SCENARIO WOULD BE THE RELEASE OF THE TOTAL CONTENTS OF A STORAGE TANK RELEASED AS A GAS OVER 10 MINUTES.  THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY RELEASED WOULD BE  56,000   POUNDS, WICH REPRESENT THE VOLUME OF THE LARGEST STORAGE TANK AS LIMITED BY DESIGN STANDARDS.

THE DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT OF .14 MG/L FOR THE WORST-CASE SCENARIO IS .74 MILES.

THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO BASED ON THE MOST LIKELY POTENTIAL INCIDENT IS A RELEASE FROM A BREAK IN A TRANSFER HOSE. EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN PROCEDURES, WHICH INCLUDE THE CLOSING OF TANK VALVES, WAS  THE ONLY ACTIVE MITIGATION CONSIDERED TO LIMIT THE AMOU

NT OF PRODUCT RELEASED

THE DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT OF .14 MG/L FOR THE ALTERNATIVE SCENARIO IS  .19 MILES. THIS RELEASE HAS THE POSSIBILITY OF EXTENDING BEYOND THE FACILITY BOUNDARY.


4.  THE ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S   ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION RULE AND WITH ALL APPLICABLE STATE CODES AND REGULATIONS.  THIS FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF " SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, K-61.1", PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN STANDARDS  INSTITUTE, INC. AS ADOPTED BY THE STATE REGULATION AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA".  COMPLIANCE WITH THESE REGULATIONS AND ON-GOING TRAINING OF OUR EMPLOYEES MAKE UP OUR ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.


5.  FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY.

THERE HAVE BEEN NO ACCIDENTIAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT :
     -  HAVE CAUSED ANY DEATHS , INJURIES OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE AT THE 
         FACILITY ; NOR

     -  TO OUR KNOWLEDGE, HAVE RESULTED IN OFFSITE DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATION, SHELTER 
         in  PLACE, PROPERTY DAMAGE, OR ENVIRONMENTAL  DAMAGE.


6.   THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.


THE FACILITY HAS:

     A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD, 29 CFR 1910.38;

     PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND THE COMMUNITY
     RIGHT-TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III   (EPCRA);

     IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY INVOLVING ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY THE WILLIAMSON COUNTY  AND MARION FIRE DEPT AND THE WILLIAMSON COUNTY LEPC.

7.   PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.

     SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY.  PERIODIC EVALUATIONS 
     ARE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS.  THERE ARE NO  
     SPECIFIC SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR  IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME.
